article.headline: American U. 81, Loyola, Md. 74
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Andre Ingram scored 16 of his 22 points in the first half and American held off a late threat in 81-74 victory over Loyola College of Baltimore on Monday night. Ingram was 4-for-4 on 3-pointers in the first half to help the Eagles (3-1) end Loyola's two-game winning streak. Although he did not make a field goal after halftime, he was perfect on 10 free throws for the game. Gerald Brown had 31 points to lead Loyola (2-2) and Michael Tuck added 15 points for the Greyhounds. The Greyhounds whittled away American's 41-26 halftime lead but could not get closer than six. Brown's 3-pointer cut the American lead to 74-68 with 55 seconds left, but the Eagles made 7-of-11 free throws in the final minute to preserve the victory.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
